website_summaries.verdict: The economical Brother DSmobile DS-640 scans quickly and accurately, but it lacks single-pass duplex scanning, making it an occasional-use model for thrifty shoppers.
cons: Lacks ADF and support for single-pass, two-sided scanning
No bundled app for business-card archiving
No support for wireless and mobile connectivity

customer_reviews.title: An abysmal product
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? The fact that 1 in 3 pages results in the paper getting scrunched up (see video) due to the fact you cannot align the paper at exactly 90 degrees to teh scanner, the resulting dark grey image of a white sheet of paper (see image) or the hopeless software which doesn't allow you to combine multiple pages. The only saving grace is that if you open powerpoint then scan, the image goes straight into powerpoint. No mention of this in the user guide. Avoid this product at all costs and either go for a flat bed scanner, or one with a proper document feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Petrie

customer_reviews.title: Very good scanner but wifi is awkward
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works really well when you scan via the USB lead plugged into to your computer. It also works really well scanning to the SD card in the scanner. However, the wifi is not great, the wifi software is awkward. Because of the wifi hassle, we just use this scanner with the USB lead plugged into the computer. I would say if you really need wireless, get this one - but if you don't mind plugging it into your computer with the USB lead, you may as well save yourself money and get the no-wifi version, the DS-620.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Parker

customer_reviews.title: Needs driver updating
customer_reviews.text: At present - 3Jan.2018 - scanner driver does not work with MAC OS 10.13.2 The Brother website (support.brother.com) gives an updated driver (dated 02-11-16) which is supposed to be for OS 10.13 but does not work either. Lovely LOOKING scanner - pity !
customer_reviews.author: NomenNescio

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use tends to work
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now and i have found it to be convenient and always (so far) works first time. Small so can be shoved out of the way when not in use. Its a top piece of kit. It has saved me some trips to the accountant i can tell you ah aha hha hahhah hh eeuurgh god kill me now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this portable scanner - it's so easy to put in the enclosed carry bag and pop it in the laptop bag. It uses a micro USB that draws the power from your computer so no messing about with SD cards and Wifi networks. Easy install of driver software which allows you to choose file type (including multi page PDF), paper size and resolution. I've been using it for digitising old photos and office paperwork for decluttering. It's fast and is whizzing through piles of paper. Highly recommended compared to more expensive products.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: SOFTWARE FOR MAC DOESN'T WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I plugged everything in and dowloaded the software needed for Mac. I downloaded not only the correct version for my current OS but also previous - nothing worked. I called Brother directly, I immediately got transferred and no help was provided whatsoever. Didn't even seem bothered. I had to get in contact with Brother again through Amazon, I was told I would get sent an email with the correct link - that never happened. I bought the Epson WorkForce DS-30 instead. Up and running immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Joyal

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you use a Mac
customer_reviews.text: The driver support is poor - brother only produce a Twain driver which is not supported by MacOS. To use in a Mac you have to use Brother’s DSMobileCapture - which is utterly awful - or pay for a third party app that supports Twain scanners. Also the driver for this regularly causes adobe pdf to crash when scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant scanner, great value, works perfectly in Linux
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic scanner, and at a great price. It is additionally, fully supported in linux (all features, and across all models in the DS range), and is really great for implementing a scan to searchable PDF workflow. Brilliant for archiving paper documents and moving to a paperless office. If you're looking for a portable scanner, that can help in digitising documents, look no further. This is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: G Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: I canonly get it to scan on one side even though I have clicked on duplex.
customer_reviews.text: To start with I could only get black and white , I eventually found the setting for colour but after scanning if there is some area that dose not reach the full width of scanner it comes out black and have to crop the excess off. had I realised that I can only scan on one side I would have gone for the cheaper one. my other make is single sided and I do not have the problem of cropping.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Risby

customer_reviews.title: Really handy and useful little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Really handy and useful little scanner. This will scan to jpg and pdf - it defaults to jpg, so I usually have to remember to flip it over to pdf after turning it on, but that is one button press. The scans of both pdf and jpg are good quality. The best thing I find about this little device is that it stores the scans on an SD card. I can then whip out the SD card and put it into my Chromebook ready to upload the scans to Google Drive. You can also do it by connecting via USB, and it even has it's own Wifi hotspot. Nice piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Syrett

customer_reviews.title: Portable and works with my MAC
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled and is a very portable and sleek looking scanner. I use a MAC, and I don't have a disk drive but I was able to download the Driver from the Brother website. I'm running 10.13 on my Mac and I couldn't initially open the DMG file (a known Apple issue), but I restarted my laptop and it opened without an issue and I've started scanning documents and it's really easy to use. So if you're running a Mac it works but it wasn't as straightforward as I'd hoped. But happy that I've bought this scanner, and love that it comes with it's own bag for protecting it while I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Roving Jay

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Overall disappointing. First thing to note this scans single pages only. No double sided or multi page scanning. Confusingly the manual applies also to a scanner who does, the 920. Therefore despite my best research, this wasn’t brought out clearly. Instructions are not great. Set up guide is thick but is sketchy instructions translated into umpteen languages. I can’t get it (with a Mac) to work through WiFi despite having bought the more expensive WiFi enabled model. I have really liked Brother before. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kingston

customer_reviews.title: I have tested this for the purpose for which it was bought and found that once I got to grips wth the process it is actually a brilliant piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Although it can be a little fiddly to use initally, I have tested this for the purpose for which it was bought and found that once I got to grips wth the process it is actually a brilliant piece of kit. Of course I ignored the user guide and just set the output to pdf and off I went, but it really is very handy, almost silent in operation and fast! Excellent bit of kit!

All in all it’s a very good portable scanner.

I think the basic model is good enough, no need to spend the extra money for the wireless function

Style Name:DS-640

Scan and go with the DSmobile DS640. Ideal for scanning single-sided documents when on the move or when you have limited desk space.

Stay organised
The ability to scan, save and share information effortlessly, makes this model a real asset to anyone that works in the field or where space is a premium.
Turning paper documents into digital files ensures your information is easier to find, safer and more convenient to edit and share.

Convenient and versatile
Lightweight and compact, the DSmobile DS-640 easily fits into your laptop bag enabling you to scan where and when you need.

Mixed media, high-quality results
Designed to scan a wide range of documents including A4 documents, ID cards and receipts, makes the DSmobile DS-640 a true work companion.
With a built-in, dedicated roller system, your documents are smoothly fed-through, guaranteeing high-quality, digital files are created every time.
